item.title: Getting banned from your own team
item.content:encoded:
Before I start

Yeah, I did get my laptop back (I brought a replacement charger), I'm happy, everything is good, and lockdown is suiting me and I might cut my hair bald any moment now.

Last year, I started a small team with my friend @Jonyk5 named DonutSquad. The rules of this team was very simple. You can join the team if you are above thirteen and not older than fifteen. We started with only two members and then, many other kids in the Glitch Forum asked to join the team, and the team gre bigger.

We started a Discord server for communicating with each other, and to provide techinical support to anyone who asked. Well, it was not all good. Our team was raided and our server was hacked and our team member's GitHub account got compromised. But we still recovered from all these events and stood strong. And then arguments between us started.

It all began with the coming of my Community Manager. I won't blame him for what happend, because he was very useful and took his role seriously. He was a much hated moderator, although he did it well, because he banned people from the server now and then, citing the Discord ToS as his reason and having no fun at all. He took advantage of the fact that he was older than me, and he bargained with me for different permissions and team admin in return for a nice Discourse forum and other stuff. Every now and then he would ask us to help him fix his coding problems. Until then, I used to solve arguments between him and other users, either because he banned someone for posting their cookie clicker save, or spammed the channel for fun along with my Discord bot. But things became bitter.

I found out that he was talking ill about me behind my back. People call such kind of people backstabbers. Apparently, he wanted even more power and wanted to be the team's admin. And to throw dirt on me, he asked a few people on the Glitch Support Forum about me, and they told him that I was selfish, rude, annoying and immature (I don't believe half of what he said, because you can get something bad about you if you ask your worst enemies. He also promised me that he would be sending me screenshots, but I'm guessing it's fake).

Now I know what online abusing and cyber bullying is like.

The chat between us became ridiculous. He called me 'selfish and dumb like he always is'. I thought everyone liked me because I never abused anyone or troubled anyone online. And I can be selfish, because I'm the founder of DonutSquad, so I can do what I feel like. Of course, he didn't like it. He said that I was

  • rude
  • bad attitude
  • selfish
  • immature
  • dumb
  • patience is a virtue (it is nothing related to me)

Furthermore, he provoked my friends for standing up to him, and muted them for silly reasons like spamming (it was actually using a command that would let you know facts about cats) and joining my duplicate server. It didn't end there. After all this, he asked me for my help for his website. I didn't help. And then, I got myself banned because I thought he was joking when he asked if I should be banned from the server. And I jokingly said yes. And it seems that he was waiting for this moment. Now I'm just an ordinary guy in the server and no longer part of Team DonutSquad.

If he wishes to continue this, I would like to see how far DonutSquad can go under his leadership in an empty server.

item.title: What Happend To Me
item.content:encoded:
This post was originally posted at https://khaleelsblog.glitch.me.

It all began on a...err, I forgot the date. Sorry, folks! Well, I'm a Regular of the Glitch Support Forum and I was happily answering a few queries, because every time I wake up in the morning, I go on a posting streak which kind of satisfies me when I see my profile picture in the first 7 topics. After, that I plug in my laptop and I go to school! 🏫

I had a good day and a good lunch and when I came back home, my mom was kinda depressed and sad about something that had happend unfortunately. Turns out, there had been voltagr fluctuations with the power supply (this is how Indian power supply is 😃) and me and my mom had plugged in my laptop and my mom had plugged in her MacBook. And then there was some hissing noises and the chargers ceased to work. You could say it blew out. Well, I was fortunate that nothing had happend to the laptop and only the charger...but the Lenovo ThinkPad T520 isn't supported by Lenovo anymore so I can't buy a replacement charger from them! And this is why, I have been inactive in both, Glitch Support and Glitch.

I've been using my mom's mobile phone ever since and it is not too bad. But to type this I had to turn off auto-correct and turn on swipe-typing. GitHub and Glitch Support Forums work well, although I have trouble coding on Glitch. But I try my best.

And my eigth-grade annual examinations are round the corner (in fact, it's next door!) and I'm gonna temporarily halt all the coding and support stuff and Discord and yadda yadda.

So to whoever is reading this, don't expect a posting streak from me for the next month. I'll be back after that!

item.title: Help, code formatting isn't workomh, I mean working!
item.content:encoded:
This post was originally posted at https://khaleelsblog.glitch.me.

The title says it all. Code formatting is not working, at least for me. I've followed everything that the 11ty website said, but it's not working. Great! At least I'm not getting any errors. Because getting an error in 11ty causes the whole website not to run!

I'll tell you something. If you decide to start blogging one day, never ever use a mobile phone for typing, unless it's an iPhone. Most Android phones use Gboard (when I typed this right now, it came as Gbiatd 😂) and they are terrible. I don't know how people type so well with Gboard because for example, when I press the letter 'h', it's the letter 'j' that's getting pressed. The only way I can type correctly now is using swipe typing. And that's the biggest mistake I'm doing right now.

Coding on mobile is also the same. It takes me hours to code something basic, which I could type very fast on a normal desktop computer. First, you gotta hunt for all the symbols like parenthesis and lesser than and greater than symbols, then I have to switch between numbers, symbols and letters in the keyboard and then I gotta put all those symbols again to close the brackets and parenthesises. No, auto closing doesn't work for Glitch on mobile phones.

That's all I'm gonna say right now. I'll type another 300 words when I'm in front of a desktop keyboard or my laptop. (Many people think this is an excuse to stop blogging, but not in my case.)

And if anyone can help me with the code formatting, let me know, if I've done it incorrectly. Email me at khalby786@gmail.com 😁

item.title: How This Blog Came Into Existance
item.content:encoded:
This post was originally posted at https://khaleelsblog.glitch.me.

So, it all began after my Hexo blog started to crash and had just missed the disk space limit (for Glitch projects).

Hang on, I wanna see how code formatting looks here:

1console.log("There's no point in formatter")

No, actually it sucks. It just this neon green coloured box that's containing the code and there's no syntax highlighting. I saw a plugin in the 11ty website for code formatting. Maybe I'll add that later. [Khaleel's Note: My original blog was made using a framework called 11ty, and the code formatting was non-existant.]

Yeah, so as I was saying, I liked how Hexo looked. It gave you a lot of themes and additionally, you could edit the main skeleton HTML, so it was very flexible. But it had numerous files which were part of each theme and then there was my 1050x1050px donut 🍩 images which caused the whole project to lag, that I couldn't even change the projects description. I tried would writing new posts on my Mom's mobile phone, but the project didn't even load! I was forced to search for an alternative. The thing was that I wanted to create one with pure code and not with blogging softwares such as WordPress. I tried Ghost blogs but they weren't great. Finally, while reading through the Glitch Blog, I found this really simple blog which was ready to be remixed. I wasted no time in remixing it and started to customize it however I liked. I had a lot of trouble writing this post, because my logs are filled with some errors regarding the date format of the post being not UTC and there might be chances that the date would show the time as 00:00 in the midnight. No, don't believe it, it's because in not mentioning the tone along with this. Now all that's left for me is to customize it even more, add the code formatting, add a custom domain and keep writing!

Thanks to @jenn (director of community engineering at Glitch) because I had to refer to jenngineering to see how to implement RSS feeds.
